stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on finishing the volcano section of the overworld (end of “Part 1”) before moving to the second area. Most of the session is spent designing a post-eruption event, refining mountain and lava textures, and experimenting with a new N64 combiner shader.
level: Secret “rising-lava” stage in Grand Sand Badland

development_findings.summary: Island areas will undergo permanent, story-driven terrain changes; first example is a volcano that erupts only after the player clears the rising-lava secret stage.
development_findings.quote: The island goes through permanent change as you're on it.

development_findings.summary: Volcano eruption cut-scene will pour lava into the initial hub, create a new stone platform, and unlock an overworld star.
development_findings.quote: You see the volcano erupt some lava that goes down here. The lava forms a big stone platform here.

development_findings.summary: A standard Bully boss ends the secret stage; post-eruption the same Bully reappears in the hub wearing corked horns and a floaty, becoming a friendly NPC.
development_findings.quote: He has corks on top of his horns and he's wearing a floaty swimming ring and he says he's chilled out.

development_findings.summary: NPC Bully will reward a star through a simple rhythm-based ‘singing’ minigame (Mario pitches on B/A/Z, Bully grunts) inspired by Rhythm Heaven.
development_findings.quote: When you play the song well enough, he thanks you with a star.

development_findings.summary: Kaze invents a ‘rescale combiner’ shader that lets him fade detail by adjusting primitive and shade colors, improving mountain-to-lava transitions without extra textures.
development_findings.quote: Now we have a rescale combiner… we can change primitive color to change the range of the texture.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 exporter bugs still cause black faces, wrong opacity and a lighthouse glitch; Kaze will leave fixes for later.
development_findings.quote: This is a Fast64 bug… I have to fix Fast64.

development_findings.summary: Texture work: switched mountain walls to a higher-res grayscale, adds lava vein overlay, plans grass tufts in cracks, and separates rocky vs grassy zones to justify volcanic damage.
Event-star milestones listed as 8, 14, 21, 30 to gate overworld happenings.
After finishing volcano polish Kaze intends to start ‘Part 2’, implying first hub art pass is nearly complete.
development_findings.quote: That's the plan for today… finish changes in Part 1… Part 2 is next up.

development_findings.summary: Design ethos: priority is an alive overworld; boss fights can remain simple if they serve that goal.
development_findings.quote: We don't try to make a good boss fight, we try to make a good overworld right now.

context_findings.summary: Kaze opens with stomach pain and later leaves mid-stream to collect aquarium plants, indicating personal life often overlaps dev time.
Expresses strong opinions on game music: praises David Wise, calls Grant Kirkhope ‘over-rated’.
context_findings.quote: I already said I'm kind of a Grant Kirkhope hater now.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on user engagement: worries AI compliments (‘glazing’) will manipulate people and degrade trust in information.
context_findings.quote: I think five years from now, we'll have whole real life catastrophes that don't actually exist.

context_findings.summary: Notes physical fitness (benches 315 lbs) and shrugs off online threats, hinting at confidence and thick skin.
context_findings.quote: Obviously I don't care… I can bench 315 pounds.

context_findings.summary: Shows collaborative attitude; explicitly invites chat back-seating and ideas.
Mentions spouse Zeina off-camera (may ‘knock out the plant man’), showing casual home-work blend.

biobak.summary: Provides real-time art critique (mountain textures, lava opacity, awkward flower entrance) and will ‘polish it up’ after Kaze’s rough pass.
biobak.quote: If you like the idea and you like the shaders I used, then I did my job good… Biobak will polish it up.

biobak.summary: Suggests subtle gameplay twists (wobbly platform for Bully fight) and questions noisy texture transitions.

zeina.summary: Off-stream but present at home; Kaze jokes she might confront the delivery person, indicating informal but supportive environment.

key_stories.title: Volcano Eruption & Bully Redemption
key_stories.summary: Clearing the secret rising-lava level unlocks a volcano eruption cut-scene that reshapes the first hub. The former Bully boss is blasted onto a new stone platform, reforms, and offers a rhythm-game star.
key_stories.challenge: Wanted the overworld to feel alive and reward repeated visits.
key_stories.process: Designed eruption trigger, mapped lava flow path, re-used the Bully model with comedic props, brainstormed star-granting interactions with chat.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on permanent terrain change plus a simple singing minigame for the star; art and scripting now in task list.
key_stories.key_quote: Imagine you beat the guy and then the lava erupts and the guy is just there on the island.

key_stories.title: Rescale Combiner Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze needed smoother mountain-to-lava transitions without extra textures. He built a custom N64 combiner that rescales texture intensity based on primitive and shade colors.
key_stories.challenge: Clashing texel density and harsh seams when mixing rocky and lava textures.
key_stories.process: Wrote new ‘rescale multitex’ combiner, tested live by fading detail on mountain tops.
key_stories.outcome: Achieved adjustable detail levels and plans to reuse the shader across the island.
key_stories.key_quote: We can change primitive color to change the range of the texture.
